review: I actually tried this for it's screen-mirroring (Miracast) function, since the price is about the same as single-function Miracast receivers.  It was horrible - watching a youtube video was jerkey, sound not synced with video -- completely unusable.  The TV image would frequently freeze for seconds at a time, meanwhile the video ran smoothly on the phone's screen.FWIW my phone is a Moto X 1st gen running Android 5.1.
author: J. Avera

review: I am giving this five stars even though I unfortunately had to return my fire stick - it had nothing to do with the actual product or performance, just an issue with my cable company that doesn't support the apps I was interested in using (HBO Go and Showtime). That being said I loved it when I tried it out and when we switch cable companies I will definitely purchase a new one. This turned my parents lower end HDTV into a Smart TV in a matter of minutes for just $40. The interface is fast (no lagging) and looks beautiful.. true HD and nothing flimsy about it. It was super easy to figure out and I could quickly teach my parents in their 50's how to work it. The Netflix app on here worked better than it did on my actual smart TV - rarely any buffering or errors. I'm genuinely upset I have to purchase a Roku instead just to use those apps!
